item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture across Indian equities, as 3,956 companies declared results reflecting a modest improvement in profitability but persistent sectoral disparities. While mid-cap firms continue to outperform their large-cap counterparts in terms of positive earnings surprises, the overall market sentiment remains cautious amid mixed financial metrics and evolving macroeconomic conditions. Time: Feb 15 2026 09:00 PM IST

item.title: Dec-2025 Quarterly Earnings Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a mixed bag of results across market capitalisation segments and sectors, as 3,956 companies declared their financials. While the proportion of companies reporting positive results has inched up slightly to 46.0%, the overall trend remains subdued compared to the previous quarter, reflecting ongoing challenges in the broader economy and sector-specific headwinds. Time: Feb 15 2026 06:00 PM IST

item.title: Paragon Finance Ltd Gains 10.33%: 4 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Rally
item.description: Paragon Finance Ltd delivered a robust weekly performance, gaining 10.33% from ₹45.32 to ₹50.00 between 9 and 13 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex which declined by 0.54% over the same period. The week was marked by a series of valuation shifts, quarterly financial results, and an upgrade in analyst ratings, all contributing to the stock’s volatile yet upward trajectory amid a challenging market backdrop. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:02 PM IST

item.title: Repro India Ltd Gains 15.74%: Key Technical Shifts and Q3 Profitability Spark Rally
item.description: Repro India Ltd. delivered a remarkable weekly performance, surging 15.74% from ₹412.30 to ₹477.20 between 9 and 13 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex which declined 0.54% over the same period. The week was marked by a notable technical momentum shift and a return to profitability in Q3 FY26, which together catalysed the sharp price appreciation despite broader market weakness. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:02 PM IST

item.title: Ircon International’s Mixed Week: -0.20% Price Change Amid Profit Concerns and Technical Headwinds
item.description: Ircon International Ltd’s stock closed the week marginally lower by 0.20% at Rs.152.95, slightly outperforming the Sensex which declined 0.54% over the same period. The week was marked by a sharp profit decline reported on 11 Feb and subsequent technical headwinds that weighed on investor sentiment, resulting in a volatile trading range and cautious market stance. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:02 PM IST

item.title: Praj Industries Gains 8.38%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Volatility
item.description: Praj Industries Ltd delivered a volatile but ultimately positive week, closing at Rs.309.15 on 13 February 2026, up 8.38% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.285.25. This performance notably outpaced the Sensex, which declined 0.54% over the same period, reflecting a week of sharp intraday swings, strong institutional interest, valuation concerns, and operational challenges that shaped investor sentiment. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:02 PM IST

item.title: Panth Infinity Ltd Edges Lower by 0.22%: 2 Key Factors Shaping This Week’s Movement
item.description: Panth Infinity Ltd closed the week marginally lower by 0.22% at Rs.8.89, underperforming the Sensex which declined 0.54%. The week was marked by a significant upgrade to a Buy rating on 9 February, driven by strong financial results and improved technical indicators, followed by a mixed reaction to the company’s Q2 FY26 earnings report. Despite volatility, the stock demonstrated resilience with notable intraday gains and a sharp rebound midweek. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:02 PM IST

item.title: Welspun Investments & Commercials Ltd Gains 1.05%: Key Milestones and Market Dynamics This Week
item.description: Welspun Investments & Commercials Ltd recorded a modest weekly gain of 1.05% from Rs.1,286.55 to Rs.1,300.00 between 9 and 13 February 2026, outperforming the Sensex which declined by 0.54% over the same period. The stock’s performance was marked by a new 52-week and all-time high on 13 February, despite some volatility and a sharp intraday decline on the final trading day. This review analyses the key events and price movements shaping the stock’s trajectory during the week. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:01 PM IST

item.title: Olympia Industries Declines 1.80% Amid 52-Week Low and Margin Pressures
item.description: Olympia Industries Ltd experienced a challenging week, with its share price declining by 1.80% from Rs.31.11 to Rs.30.55, underperforming the Sensex which fell by 0.54%. Despite early gains on Monday and Tuesday, the stock faced selling pressure midweek, culminating in a steady downtrend amid fresh 52-week lows and mixed quarterly results. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:01 PM IST

item.title: ASM Technologies Ltd Gains 9.15%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Move
item.description: ASM Technologies Ltd recorded a robust weekly gain of 9.15%, closing at Rs.2,771.40 on 13 Feb 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex which declined by 0.54% over the same period. The stock’s strong performance was driven by a combination of technical developments and valuation shifts that shaped investor sentiment throughout the week. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:01 PM IST

item.title: Seasons Textiles Gains 1.41%: Valuation Shift and Mixed Weekly Signals
item.description: Seasons Textiles Ltd recorded a modest weekly gain of 1.41%, closing at Rs.18.00 on 13 Feb 2026, outperforming the Sensex which declined by 0.54% over the same period. The week was marked by a notable valuation shift to very attractive levels amid persistent revenue pressures and cautious market sentiment, reflected in a strong sell mojo grade. Daily price movements showed initial strength followed by a late-week pullback, correlating with key corporate developments and market dynamics. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:01 PM IST

item.title: Graphite India Gains 4.71%: Quarterly Turnaround and Market Resilience Highlight Week
item.description: Graphite India Ltd. delivered a robust weekly performance, rising 4.71% from ₹619.20 to ₹648.35, significantly outperforming the Sensex which declined 0.54% over the same period. The stock’s gains were supported by a strong quarterly earnings report on 9 February and a subsequent upgrade in mojo grade, despite some operational challenges highlighted during the week. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:01 PM IST

item.title: PVV Infra Ltd’s Subtle Decline of 0.58% Masks Strong Financial Upgrades
item.description: PVV Infra Ltd experienced a mixed week from 9 to 13 February 2026, closing marginally lower by 0.58% at Rs.5.16, slightly underperforming the Sensex which declined 0.54%. The week was marked by a strong quarterly earnings turnaround, an upgrade to a Strong Buy rating, and notable shifts in valuation and quality grades, reflecting both optimism and caution among investors. Time: Feb 15 2026 05:01 PM IST
